name: Research and Records
section_name: Learn about Virginia research and records.

choices.name: Get started with research for your Virginia ancestors.

hidden.summary:
• Learn successful research strategies for Virginia ancestors.
  • Record Finder: Use the Record Finder to determine records for Virginia research.

text:
1. Introduction: Learn about basic Virginia research strategies.

    ☆ FS—Basic Virginia Research Tips and Strategies

  2. Follow this research study for Virginia ancestors, from 1880 to the present.

    ☆ FS—Step-by-Step Virginia Research, 1880-Present

  3. Get an overview of Virginia research in this video.

    ☆ FS—Virginia Overview—4:04
  4. Learn tips for Virginia research in these Ancestry videos.

    ☆ AAC—A Little Background—4:16 (account required)
    ☆ AAC—Sketching Out When and Where—4:16 (account required)

  5. Ancestry: Explore resources for Virginia research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Virginia Resources
    ☆ AC—Virginia State Research Guide, 5 pgs.

  6. Record Finder: Use the Virginia Record Finder to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—Virginia Record Finder

    7. Additional Records
    1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
    2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
    3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
    4. Learn about research in colonial Virginia.

      ☆ AC—Colonial Virginia


    Ethnic
    1. African American: Learn about African Americans in Virginia in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Virginia

    2. Learn more about African American records.

      ☆ AG—Virginia African American Records

    3. Learn more about resources for African American research before 1870.

      ☆ African American research at the Library of Virginia to 1870

    4. Explore narrative resources at the Virginia Untold site.
    5. Explore the African American Gateway for Virginia.
    6. Native American: Learn about American Indians in Virginia in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Virginia
Additional Records

1. Explore Virginia historical resources on FamilySearch.

name: Archives and Libraries
section_name: Learn about Virginia archives and libraries.

choices.name: Learn about Virginia archives and libraries.

hidden.summary:
• Explore statewide and regional collections.
  • Explore books and photos that can be helpful in your research.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Learn about Virginia archives and libraries in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Virginia Archives and Libraries
    ☆ Virginia State Archives: Wonderful Local Sources for Genealogical Research

  2. Explore the Virginia Memory site.
  3. Explore the Virginia Heritage site.
  4. Explore the State Archives and Libraries site for Virginia.
  5. Explore Virginia State Library collections.
  6. Explore the ☆Books We Own site for Virginia genealogy publications. Volunteers may be available for lookup services.
  7. Search for ☆free online books on Virginia research on the FamilySearch site.
  8. Photos: Explore historical photo resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

hidden.summary:
• Explore city and county directories to find Virginia ancestors.
  • Discover the different types of information in directories, such as streets, churches, historical info, etc.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for city directories. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Learn about Virginia city directories in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Virginia Directories

  2. Sites: Explore Virginia city directories on the Ancestor Hunt site.
  3. Find out more about city directories in this research guide from Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Six Things to Find—3 pgs.

  4. Explore Virginia city directories on the ☆Ancestry site.
  5. Explore Virginia ☆historical directories by county.
  6. Explore additional links for Virginia city directories on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
QUIKLinks

name: Maps and Gazetteers

hidden.summary:
• Discover the history of Virginia newspapers.
  • Learn more about how to use Virginia periodical and manuscripts.

    ☆ Research Free Historical Virginia Newspapers—9:00

hidden.summary:
• Find research clues in the Library of Congress historical newspaper collection.
  • Search Virginia online newspaper sites.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for newspaper records. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Search for ☆Virginia historical newspapers in the Library of Congress collection.
  2. Find links to Virginia newspapers on the Wikipedia site.
  3. Search the Virginia Online Historical Newspapers site.
  4. Explore online copies of the Virginia Gazette, published from 1736-1780 in Williamsburg.
  5. Explore Virginia newspaper resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
  6. See additional Virginia newspaper resources on the Linkpendium site.
  7. Explore additional links for Virginia newspapers and obituaries on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.

choices.name: There are a number of websites with valuable resources for Virginia research.

text:
1. Explore links in ☆Cyndi's List.
  2. Explore links in ☆Linkpendium.
  3. Explore links in ☆Genealogylinks.net.
  4. Explore links in ☆LDSGenealogy.com.

choices.name: Use the QUIKLinks (lightning bolts) or Virginia County links (bottom) to quickly search common record collections for Virginia.

text: Note : To search records on these sites, you must be registered on the site or be at a FamilySearch Center.

1. In the QUIKLinks, click the link for FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast, or MyHeritage to view the corresponding record collection.
  2. Scroll down near the bottom of this page to see available county records. Click the name of the county for FamilySearch, or A for Ancestry, or L for Linkpendium.

1. In FamilySearch, explore the Virginia Online Genealogy Records page for a variety of record collections.
  2. In each program (FamilySearch, Ancestry, or Findmypast), explore additional record collections besides the ones listed in QUIKLinks.

name: Get Help
section_name: Get help with your Virginia research.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

text:
1. Visit the Virginia Genealogy Network page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the Virginia Genealogy page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the Virginia Genealogy - Just Ask! page on Facebook.
  4. Visit the U.S. South Genealogy Research page on Facebook.
  5. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for Virginia.

1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about Virginia research.
  2. Explore the Virginia research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Explore the ☆FamilySearch community for help with Virginia research.
  4. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about Virginia research.
  5. Explore Virginia research questions in the ☆Genealogy Stack Exchange.
Regional Groups

hidden.exercises: • * Proficient: Make a list of Facebook groups, mailing lists, and genealogy societies of interest, and then join or subscribe to them.

text:
1. Learn about genealogy societies in Virginia in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Virginia Societies

  2. Explore the Virginia Genealogical Society site.
  3. Explore the Virginia Historical Society site.
  4. Explore Virginia genealogy society sites on Cyndi's List.
  5. Get help at a family history center in Virginia.
